snippet: Three major legal cases may influence the 2012 election, but the cases also illustrate how politics shape the Supreme Court.
abstract: Editorial asserts that the Supreme Court's decision to hear major cases on contentious issues in an election year underscores not only the power of the court to shape American life, but also the way politics shapes the court; argues that the political influence on these major cases underlines how the 2012 election will likely determine the law's direction.
lead_paragraph: Three major legal cases may influence the 2012 election, but the cases also illustrate how politics shape the Supreme Court.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
